questions.text: What does HTML stand for?
questions.explanation: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language, the standard markup language for creating web pages.

questions.text: Which tag is used for the largest heading in HTML?
questions.explanation: <h1> is used for the largest (most important) heading, with <h2> to <h6> for progressively smaller headings.

questions.text: What does CSS stand for?
questions.explanation: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets, used to style and layout web pages.

questions.text: Which property is used to change text color in CSS?
questions.explanation: The 'color' property is used to set the color of text in CSS.

questions.text: Where is JavaScript code typically placed in an HTML document?
questions.explanation: JavaScript can be placed in <head>, <body>, or external .js files. Best practice is to place before closing </body> tag for performance.

questions.text: What is the purpose of the alt attribute in tag?
questions.explanation: The alt attribute provides alternative text for images, displayed if image fails to load and used by screen readers for accessibility.

questions.text: Which CSS property controls element spacing?
questions.explanation: margin (outside spacing), padding (inside spacing), and border all contribute to element spacing and layout.

questions.text: What does DOM stand for?
questions.explanation: DOM stands for Document Object Model, a programming interface for HTML/XML documents representing structure as a tree of objects.

questions.text: Which method is used to select an element by ID in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: Both document.getElementById() and document.querySelector('#id') can select elements by ID.

questions.text: What is responsive web design?
options: Design that adapts to different screen sizes
questions.explanation: Responsive web design creates websites that adapt layout and content to different screen sizes and devices.

questions.text: Which HTML5 element is used for navigation?
questions.explanation: <nav> is the HTML5 semantic element for navigation links.

questions.text: What does AJAX stand for?
questions.explanation: AJAX stands for Asynchronous JavaScript and XML, a technique for creating fast and dynamic web pages.

questions.text: Which CSS framework is known for its grid system?
questions.explanation: Bootstrap is particularly known for its responsive grid system based on flexbox.

questions.text: What is a closure in JavaScript?
options: Function with access to outer scope
questions.explanation: A closure is a function that has access to its own scope, outer function's scope, and global scope.

questions.text: Which HTTP method is used for retrieving data?
questions.explanation: GET method is used to retrieve data from a server. It should not change server state.

questions.text: What is the purpose of localStorage?
questions.explanation: localStorage allows web applications to store data locally in the browser with no expiration time.

questions.text: Which CSS property creates flexible layouts?
questions.explanation: Both Flexbox (display: flex) and CSS Grid (display: grid) create flexible, responsive layouts.

questions.text: What is Node.js?
questions.explanation: Node.js is a JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 engine, allowing JavaScript to run on the server-side.

questions.text: Which is NOT a JavaScript framework?
questions.explanation: Django is a Python web framework, not a JavaScript framework.
questions.hint: Think about which is not JavaScript-based.

questions.text: What does SEO stand for?
questions.explanation: SEO stands for Search Engine Optimization, the practice of increasing website visibility in search engine results.

questions.text: Which protocol is used for secure HTTP?
questions.explanation: HTTPS (HTTP Secure) uses SSL/TLS encryption to secure data transmission between browser and server.

questions.text: What is a REST API?
questions.explanation: REST (Representational State Transfer) is an architectural style for designing networked applications using HTTP methods.

questions.text: Which CSS unit is relative to font size?
questions.explanation: em is relative to parent element's font size, rem is relative to root element's font size.

questions.text: What is Git used for?
questions.explanation: Git is a distributed version control system for tracking changes in source code during software development.

questions.text: Which is a NoSQL database?
questions.explanation: MongoDB is a document-based NoSQL database, while others are relational SQL databases.

questions.text: What is Webpack?
questions.explanation: Webpack is a static module bundler for JavaScript applications that bundles JavaScript files for usage in a browser.

questions.text: What does CORS stand for?
questions.explanation: CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) is a mechanism that allows restricted resources to be requested from another domain.

questions.text: Which is a CSS preprocessor?
questions.explanation: Sass, Less, and Stylus are all CSS preprocessors that extend CSS with features like variables, nesting, and mixins.

questions.text: What is JWT?
questions.explanation: JWT (JSON Web Token) is a compact, URL-safe means of representing claims to be transferred between two parties.

questions.text: What is the virtual DOM?
questions.explanation: Virtual DOM is a lightweight JavaScript representation of the actual DOM, used by libraries like React for efficient updates.
